ygData.subject: Re: Skill Cap
ygData.msgSnippet: It appears as though the cap has been removed.  My gnome is 27th and according to the skill cap that we had figured out [(lvl-15)*5], my max skill should be
ygData.messageBody:
It appears as though the cap has been removed. My gnome is 27th and
according to the skill cap that we had figured out [(lvl-15)*5], my max
skill should be 60. However on the weekend I was able to raise it to 65
with no problems at all.

On another note, I had a very good success rate. I was able to raise my
skill 15 points after making 37 flameless lanterns and only failed 5 times
- I had worse results with blacksmithing! My Int was 163 and my wis was
91 (thanks to a kind enchanter who cast Insight and Brilliance on me -
highly recommend getting these buffs before attempting to raise skill).
Has anyone else had similar results? I'm wondering if Verrant made the
skill a little easier after receiving so many complaints.

QdP

"Quasinom de Plume is my quasi nom-de-plume"

--- Wopr <inewton@...> wrote:
> On the skill cap issue, I know it used to exist if only for the number
> of
> people that would complain about no increases on this list. That
> chatter
> has gone away though, so...
>
> I have a lvl 18 gnome that hasn't even trained or attempted one point in
> tinkering, yet. I will set him tinkerin' until I don't see any more
> skill
> increases and let the list know how far I get.
>
> Its not that I don't believe you, Grundup the necro, I just want a
> second
> opinion. :)
>
> Wopr, gnome wizard
> Bertoxxulous
>
>
<HR>
<html>
>
